summary: This document is a travel authorization request and itinerary for three Assistant United States Attorneys (AUSAs) from the Southern District of New York to travel to Stockholm, Sweden in February 2020. The purpose was to interview a potential witness (a relative of a victim) in the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his associates for violations including 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423 (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity). The document includes flight details, a security training certificate, and a detailed foreign travel questionnaire.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signs the memorandum requesting approval for foreign travel for three AUSAs to interview a witness in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jonathan Pelletier
persons.role: Acting Chief Financial Officer, Executive Office of U.S. Attorneys
persons.context: Recipient of the travel authorization memorandum from Geoffrey Berman.

persons.name: Ed Tyrrell
persons.context: Approved the travel request for the AUSAs to Sweden, initially for late January and then rescheduled for early February 2020.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation centers on criminal conduct undertaken by him and his associates, specifically the transportation of minors for illicit sexual activity.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a subject of the investigation, believed to be a citizen of the U.S., U.K., and France.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, submits a travel authorization request to Pelletier, the Acting CFO of EOUSA.
Maxwell is identified as a subject of the same investigation into criminal conduct undertaken by Epstein and his associates.
Berman's memo states that Tyrrell has approved the travel request for the AUSAs.

events.title: AUSA Travel to Stockholm for Witness Interview
events.description: Three Assistant U.S. Attorneys travel from New York to Stockholm, Sweden, to interview a relative of a victim in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: High Threat Security Overseas Seminar Completion
events.description: An unnamed AUSA completed the HTSOS training, a prerequisite for the official travel to Sweden.

events.title: Travel Authorization Request Submitted
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman submits a memorandum requesting approval for foreign travel for AUSAs to conduct witness interviews in Sweden.

locations: 31 West 8th Street, Apartment 3, New York, NY 10011
Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: In February 2020, the SDNY was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and associates, specifically for violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423 (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity).
The investigation involved interviewing a witness in Sweden who was a relative of a victim and could significantly corroborate the victim's account.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a subject of the same investigation.
The travel was highly sensitive, requiring High Threat Security Overseas Seminar (HTSOS) training and official approval from DOJ officials.
The document reveals the logistical and bureaucratic steps (itinerary, questionnaire, approvals) behind a federal investigation into high-profile figures.
